conversations.content: So this is the Halidom. I never thought I'd find myself guest of a human-run castle.
Welcome, Isaac! C'mere, the prince is waiting!
Greetings, Isaac. I am Euden. It's very nice to meet you.
You hail from the sylvan holy land in the north, I am told?
Yes. It is known as Initio—a land steeped in history and shepherded by the divine guardian of the forest, Yggdrasil.
Ah, right. I heard from Luca and Sarisse that your land prizes the traditions of the sylvan people.
You're well-informed. That makes this easier.
As a guardsman of the verdure, I have come here seeking a way to preserve our culture for generations to come.
My encounter with Luca and Sarisse has made me realize that my current methods have their limits. Thus, I shall remain here for a time, with your assent.
Of course. You're welcome as long as you like. Are there any places you're interested in? I'd be happy to guide you anywhere.
A kind offer, and one I shall accept. Show me to a place where disparate traditions unite under a common banner.
I know little of the world beyond the emerald wealds of the sylvans, you see.
I would like to learn the ways of the other peoples of the world and take them as lessons to preserve our own.
An interesting endeavor! Luckily, I know just the place.
Oh!
This here's the pride of the Halidom: our workshop! Here, we have human craftsfolk working alongside rokkan masters.
It's a good place to see the differences between the two races. I figured it might impart some wisdom.
Hey everyone! Can I have your attention for just a moment?
Euden! You sure can! Who's our guest, and what's he need crafted?
Ah, actually, we're not here to commission anything. Isaac wanted to come and do a little survey of our workshop facilities.
Oh, so he wants to become an apprentice? At long last, I'll finally have my own little newbie to take under my wing!
Er, no, I...
Easy, Renee. You've already flustered the poor man.
It's unusual for a sylvan to take interest in a smithy. Not that I mind, though.
It's A-OK in our book, too. Feel free to hang around as long as you like.
You've my gratitude. I accept your generous offer.
Gotta increase the fire's heat by just two degrees...
Arise, O flame!
Awesome. Sis, you're up!
You betcha!
You never seen fire before? You've been eyeballing it pretty hard for a while now.
The use of fire is strictly forbidden in our wood. I've never really laid eyes on it.
To us, it is a threat. One wrong move, and the forest could be set ablaze in but the blink of an eye.
I actually hold you in high esteem, being able to control a fire without flinching.
Rokkans are a little better-equipped to handle the heat than most. We've never really had cause to fear it, honestly.
Booo. Meanie rokkans and your special fire privileges. Kinda makes me jealous.
We're human, so I wouldn't say things are quite the same for us.
Those red-hot squats that Coach used to make us do still haunt my dreams even now.
Yeah, training by squatting...in the middle of open flames. Rough stuff...
Truly?! That is harsh training indeed...
The strength of your fire's life-or-death when it comes to smithin'. Gotta get it real hot to make your weapons.
Oh, is that the newly finished sword? Nicely done.
Hee hee. Thanks! Hey—Isaac, was it? Here, would you like to hold a freshly forged sword? Still hot outta the oven.
I would. My thanks.
This blade... It is so much lighter than I suspected. Exceptionally easy to handle. Utterly unlike what we have in Initio.
If it is no imposition, I would like to hold a weapon of rokkan make as well.
Sure thing. I think this sword'll help you see the difference.
It does not appear to be all that different from a human weapon, but... Hm?!
Huh. Didn't think a sylvan could heft it.
It is identical in size to the other sword, and yet the weight differs dramatically.
It's all about the way each is made.
For rokkan warriors, a sword like this is featherweight. Human weapons just don't have enough heft for us, broadly speaking.
That's why rokkans prioritize strength over lightness. It's been like that for ages.
Ah. So this, too, is rooted in tradition.
Yep. There've been plenty of changes over the years, though.
Is that so?
Weapons are practical tools. We're always seeking to make them better.
If we let our techniques stagnate, we'd have no choice but to shutter up. That's why we strive to iterate.
After all, I'd hate for everything that's been handed down for so long to come to an end with my generation.
Same for us.
We inherited our skills from our father, but we can't mimic his methods perfectly.
Yep. He had muscle where we don't. And in smithing, strength can sometimes be part of the game.
That's why we devised a way for the three of us to split up the job.
That way, we could keep the technique and name of Regis's workshop alive, even after his death.
＂Many hands make light work.＂ That's our slogan!
I see... So you carry on traditions, while incorporating changes based on current circumstances.
(This may be a necessary way of thinking. We, the people of Initio, have avoided change for far too long.)
Thank you. This has been most educational. It was indeed the right decision to come to this castle.
(Guardian Yggdrasil... Hear my vow.)
(I swear to you that I shall find a way to see sylvan culture, yourself included, carried on to future generations.)
Man, again?
Yeah... I'm beginning to think this is impossible. It's going REALLY badly.
What are you groaning about, Luca? And who is your companion here?
Oh, you're the sylvan from the north! I'm Aeleen. I'm a nurse here at the Halidom.
Aeleen also looks after the castle garden. See, she's been helping us try to cultivate a new field...
But no matter what we do, we can't get any crops to grow at all. This is the first time this sort of thing has ever happened.
A new field, you say? Luca, am I correct in assuming that you performed the land ablutions?
The heck's a land abloo shum?
So you don't know about them. I see... Hmmm...
Your name was Aeleen, correct? Will you guide me to your fields?
Oh, sure!
Here. This is where we're making the new field for the village.
I see. Do you have any objections to me beginning the land ablution ceremony?
By all means. Knock yourself out.
Then I shall begin.
O great earth. Please, grant us your leave to assert our will upon this land.
Our gratitude to you, O generous earth. We shall be as one with your soil.
(Wasn't sure what to expect, but I guess it's some kinda ritual prayer. Is this gonna change anything?)
(Luca, shhh. He's in the middle of doing his thing... Oh.)
(Isaac...? Why did he suddenly lie down?)
... *munch*
(Um... Did he just eat dirt?!)
Luca. Take this canteen.
Huh? Uh, sure. But what am I supposed to do with it?
Wait, what'd you PUT in this thing?!
Soil.
Yes, I know that, but that's not what I meant! I'm asking why you ruined perfectly good water by takin' it to ground town!
The goal is to create mud using soil from the field and drink it.
I see, gotcha, yeah, okay... Drink the... Wait, WHAT?!
Won't you, er...get a stomachache?
It won't be an issue. The land ablution is a common practice.
So you're telling me you straight-up eat dirt. Like, on purpose. Regularly.
You truly are ignorant of our traditions. Go to your village elder from time to time and have them teach you.
Oof...
The land ablution is a ritual which has been handed down among sylvans since time immemorial. It is a kind of... groundbreaking ceremony for new fields.
Cultivating the land is akin to the earth sharing itself with us.
Thus, when you intend to make a new plot arable, you consume soil from it, with great gratitude for its bounty.
So just saying a prayer wouldn't work?
The consumption part of the ritual is how we demonstrate our union with the earth.
Plus, the soil in your mouth will tell you what crops are suitable for it.
You have completely and utterly lost me.
Then let me phrase it this way: what have you tried to plant in this field so far?
Um, well, a bunch of different fruits. But none of them have taken...
I should think not. This land tastes suited to root vegetables. Try planting some of those instead.
You can tell that from EATING DIRT?!
Incredible. I never knew there was a ritual that could do something like this.
What are you so impressed by? This sort of thing is one of the chief cultural touchstones of the sylvans.
I mean, I'VE never seen anybody do it.
That is because essentially, you have never had to cultivate new land. The people of Myriage have taken good care of the land they already have.
But the other side to that coin is that a custom is lost when there is no opportunity to learn of it. Such is the case with ancient traditions.
This is why you must study well and be the link that preserves it for your descendants.
Huh, no kidding? All righty, then! I'm gonna give this land ablution thing a go!
Me too. I must show gratitude for the blessings the land shares with us.
So...I lie on the ground, and then lick the soil...
...Well, Luca? Any insights coming to mind?
Nope. Uh, Isaac, how do you figure out what the taste means?
Practice.
PRACTICE?!
Relax. As you build experience, you will come to discern soil's varying flavors.
Is that how it works? Um, okay... Isaac! Please teach me about the different soil tastes and the land ablutions, too!
What? Even though you are human?
I'm pretty sure we'll need to start new fields in the future.
And I want to learn, so that way we don't forget to show our gratitude to the earth.
I also don't want to put a strain on the plants or the land by planting crops that aren't suited to certain places.
Aeleen, you are a kind human indeed.
Oh! Um, you think so?
I do. It brings me great joy as a man of the woods to see what respect for nature you hold in your heart.
Very well. I would be glad to teach you.
Really?! Thank you!
Ooh, here's an even better idea: let's teach the other people in the castle, too!
Yeah!
(To think sylvan culture will be respected and preserved by other races...)
(In the forest, many lives intertwine, shaping the environment in turn.)
(Perhaps this world is much the same, rich as it is in diversity and camaraderie.)
Urgh... Heavy... Okay, here I... ACK!
Are you all right, Sarisse?
Oof. I almost fumbled big-time. Appreciate the save, Isaac!
What's all that you're carrying?
Oh, I'm bringing a bunch of supplies to help with village reconstruction work.
Allow me to carry some. I'd be happy to help with the restoration effort as well.
What?! But...
Do you object to me coming along?
It's not that, it's just... Ah, forget it. You sure you don't mind helping?
Not in the slightest.
We've been awaiting your arrival, Sarisse. Ah, and thank you for your assistance, Isaac.
Heya, Cleo! Your carpentry tools, as requested! Where's my bro?
He's off to help cut trees down with the others to supplement the lumber supply.
Cleo! Got a moment? Someone's been hurt.
Certainly. My apologies to you both, but I'll need to step away for a little while.
Tell me something, Sarisse... Was this village formed by clearing forest?
Yes. Luca started it—to create a place where different races could live as one.
You mean to say that LUCA did this?! All these trees fell at his hand?
There were other possible locations, but we agreed that this was the ideal spot for what he wanted to accomplish.
Even so, to us, the forest is the great mother—! But...wait.
Is that why you hesitated to bring me here?
Yeah. But honestly? I wanted you to see it too, Isaac.
This village is a place that accepts everyone, regardless of their race or way of thinking.
I'm afraid I still don't fully understand.
See, we didn't have enough settlements for the people of New Alberia to live in.
But this village is far more than that. More than anything, it's the realization of Luca's dream to create a home where humans, rokkans, and sylvans can all live together.
It was attacked, though, and so now we're doing reconstruction.
Hm. It would seem my offer to assist comes at a critical juncture, then.
Would you, though? Even if we have to ask you to cut trees down to do it?
If this town was not destroyed by natural disaster, then these woods have accepted it as well.
Further, I understand well the despair of dreams falling apart. I have no reason NOT to help.
Isaac! Thank you!
(What am I hesitating about? I can't turn back now...)
Out on an evening walk, are you?
Ah! You are...Cleo, correct?
The very same. May I join you?
Your company would be most welcome...
Is there something on your mind?
What...?
It's written all over your face, and has been since you were helping out with the village restoration. I'm here to listen, if you wish.
You are a keen observer of people. Yes... You have me sussed.
I came here to learn how I might change my holy land for the better. And yet I am so frightened of that change that I cannot stand it.
Go on.
To preserve the traditions and culture of the sylvans, we must reform our laws regarding the holy land.
Initio has never allowed change, and unwittingly, this created friction with the world beyond the forest.
That friction will only breed conflict and destroy everything we've worked to protect.
Even so, I... I am afraid. My knees tremble, betraying my resolve.
Fearing change is natural. I was the same way.
You were?
Yes. In the same way you revere the holy land, I have protected the Mistholt since the era of the previous king's reign.
The previous king, you say?
Yes. Of an age three centuries past.
Three hundred years?! How wrong I was to assume you among my generation...
Hee hee. Looks can be deceiving.
And a lot can change in three centuries. A different king. A different populace.
The interior of the castle—its very atmosphere. I've felt lonely and afraid facing all of these things and more.
It's like my memories of the past are being painted over...
How did you come to accept change, Cleo?
I realized that even if their form changes, the feelings remain the same.
How do you figure?
Euden wishes for peace more than anyone else, and he fights for it. His Majesty's feelings live on in him.
In that way, my old feelings continue on, unchanged. Realizing that helped me understand that change needn't be feared.
I suppose you might say...that it is a Halidom tradition to grow around a heart that yearns for peace.
A tradition, you say... And one you've preserved dutifully all these years. You truly impress, Cleo.
You flatter me overmuch. Look, Isaac. This is what I think.
Tradition and culture exist as a way for people to inherit the feelings of their ancestors.
Yes... That is indeed the essence of tradition and culture.
Thus, my duty is to see those feelings passed on to the next generation, even if the form they take changes.
Thank you, Cleo. Now I can face change with my head held high.
I hardly deserve thanks—you yourself found that strength within. Now, shall we head back? I'd be happy to brew us some herbal tea if you need help winding down.
That would be lovely. Please do. I suspect I will dream well tonight.
Where is the prince of the Halidom?!
Wh-what's going on?
Please calm yourself, Elder!
Don't stop me, Sylas!
Is that Sylas's...?
Greetings, Elder of the northeast forest. What do you need with me?
What do I NEED? For you to hand over the thief hiding away in this castle, that's what!
Please, calm down. I don't follow.
I speak of the nurse of the Halidom! She picked one of our prized camirela herbs!
You can't mean Aeleen, can you?
Yes? I'm Aeleen. Do you need some—
THIEF! You would dare come and steal the camirela from our woods?!
What?! What are you talking about?
Elder! What evidence have you for this allegation?
Oh, you want evidence? I have plenty! I saw a human figure fleeing the woods!
And once the figure had escaped, I found naught but a void where the camirela once grew. Oh, how lamentable!
But all you saw was a figure, yes? That's hardly decisive proof that Aeleen did it...
I didn't say I was finished, boy. I also went and inquired among the people of the village about the culprit.
That's when I heard a story about a person who was using the herb in medicinal compounds. And it was YOU!
I-I mean, it's true that I heal using the camirela, but I got it from Sylas...
Sir, you labor under a misunderstanding. I took the camirela I cultivated in the village, produced more at the Halidom, and gave some to her.
Is covering for her like that not proof that you yourself were complicit in her larceny?
None save the sylvans know where the camirela grows. How shameful of you to abet these humans!
What?!
Hey, okay, now you're taking this too far!
It's the truth. Ever since he started consorting with humans, this kind of  thing—
Hold a moment.
Isaac?
Hm? Who are you?
Forgive me for intruding on this matter. I am Isaac, a guardian of the holy land of Initio.
Elder, with due respect, Aeleen is not the type to thoughtlessly pilfer something so important to the sylvans.
Isaac...
To determine guilt without definitive proof, without listening to your brethren...we of the forest should know better than that.
Grrr! You speak beyond your station, young man. What does a stranger like you know?!
I know that to tread upon our great Mother Nature is an offense of the highest order. Thus...
I will apprehend any villain who would profane Her and Her myriad bounties.
I'm so sorry to rope you into this, Isaac.
Worry not. Your demonstrable respect for nature has convinced me of your innocence in this matter.
We won't let this accusation stand, Aeleen. Rest easy.
Everyone... Thank you.
We've gone around to the nearby towns and sylvan villages to gather info.
There are other cases where valuable medicinal herbs were picked in the same way.
And 'cause of that, the prices of herbs and medicine made from 'em are out of control. Some no-good trafficker's the culprit here, no doubt.
I see. Sarisse, can you mark the sites of said unjust harvests on this map?
Got it. Let's see, here...here...and here.
Seems like they're only targeting herbs with a high resale value. And their sphere of activity is wide...
Yeah. There's no way a solo act could cover that much ground. It's gotta be a coordinated effort.
I think so as well. Especially considering the recent spate of bad weather, which would make woodland traversal difficult.
Poor weather...? Wait, that could be it! Sarisse, next, please mark the map with the dates when the incidents took place.
Huh? Okay. Um... I think this is about right. But what does that have to do with it?
I knew it! All the nights on which the incidents happened were overcast.
Further, all the herb patches were downwind when the thefts occurred.
In other words, the culprits timed their efforts around when the wind created cloud cover, blocking the moon and stars.
You telling me you remember the weather and wind direction for all those days?! Like, offhand?!
Of course. I am a guardsman of the verdure. My people's lives depend on Mother Nature. I remember about a month's worth weather at a time.
That's incredible...
Now, I think it highly likely that the next crime will happen on a night with many clouds, at an herb patch downwind.
I can predict the weather myself, but if possible, I would like to take into account the estimations of others as well.
Melsa's great at forecasts! I'll go get her!
Please do. Euden, would you be kind enough to bolster our ranks for this operation with some of your allies who possess superlative night vision?
Of course. I'll go call them right away.
Much appreciated. This violation of Mother Nature shall continue no longer!
...No suspicious folks for now.
Yes. But the culprits are going to target this herb patch, no doubt about it. It ticks every box on the list.
It's gotten pretty late, though. The sky's been blanketed by clouds for a while now. Are these herb-burglars really coming?
We've got our people on lookout all around us, so I highly doubt we missed them.
Patience is a virtue when hunting, Luca.
Yeah, yeah. Hey...wait. Were those footsteps just now?
I heard them as well. Someone approaches!
Our other allies haven't noticed yet. And I can't line up a clear shot from here.
No. This is more than adequate.
H-hey! Your arrow's never gonna make it! You're just gonna send 'em running for the hills!
Who do you think you're talking to? If I couldn't hunt from this paltry distance, how could I call myself a guardsman?
...Hah!
Uwagh! The hell?!
That was the culprit! Go, everyone!
Yeah!
Uwaaaagh!
Dammit. Can't believe we'd get caught like this...
You have violated nature's providence. Steel yourself for your punishment.
Wait, wait! All we did was come to check out some intel we got about this spot!
The sylvan information broker told us we could harvest as many medicinal herbs as we wanted, so—
What did you say?!
Tch... He's still not here. Deal time's long since passed.
I'm afraid your ＂business partner＂ won't be coming.
Who are you people? And what do you mean, they ain't coming?
They're currently occupied with disclosing details of your illicit dealings to our allies.
You're the sylvan information broker who told them where to find medicinal herbs, correct?
...So what if I am?
You will atone for your crimes against the mother forest.
Crimes? Bah ha ha! What are you on about, guy? It's called an effective use of resources!
Medicinal herbs grow all over the place. They ain't gonna disappear if we go pickin' 'em, so it'd be a waste if I didn't make some coin offa it!
That's why you started selling information about them to black marketeers?
Money makes the world go 'round, pal. No point hoardin' stuff that folks are willin' to pay top value for.
Sylvans're a buncha buttheads, if you ask me. Sittin' on a veritable goldmine and just holing up among the trees...
Bastard! You would dare besmirch the people of the wood's—hrm?
You gonna finish that thought, pretty boy, or should I finish it for ya?
Quiet. I sense footsteps—fiends. A whole horde of them is headed this way! Everyone, draw your weapons!
What?!
Haaaah!
Yaaaah!
Those ears of yours are as sharp as ever, Isaac! You really saved our bacon there.
Any guardsman of the verdure would be able to do as much. More importantly, where has the information broker gone?!
Oh! There's the little weasel! He tried to slip away while we were fighting!
Heh, guess my luck hasn't run out after all, what with those fiends showin' up when they—
Graaaaaaaaargh!
YIPES! SOMEBODY... HELP MEEE!
Y-you...! You...saved me?
Are you okay?
Why did you help me...?
I do as the mother forest bids me. Though you bring harm to the woods, you live among them just the same.
The forest is granting you a chance to right your wrongs.
What ＂wrongs＂? I'm just using it efficiently, like I told you—
Could you hold fast to that excuse if at the endpoint of your actions laid the forest's death?
Huh? What's that supposed to mean?
I have been to inspect the herb patches that you guided profiteers to ravage. Each crop had been plucked, root and all, before they could sow their seeds.
That land will remain forever fallow.
What?! There's no way! The other sylvans pick those herbs all the time!
Because they have rules laid down which protect the workings of nature, inoculating the land's bounty against exhaustion.
It seems to me that you have been incorrectly assuming that such plant life grows without significant effort.
Gh...
You and your ilk, selling information, have thought of nothing but money.
Were you to stay the course, it would spell the destruction of the forest, and then countless creatures, sylvans included, will lose their home.
Seeing that you have some familiarity with the land, you must hail from this place too. Know that your actions portend only doom for the land you call home.
Surely you grew up playing in the woods. Would you feel nothing if the mother forest that raised you died at your own hand?
If you have any heart left for Mother Nature, return to your home village and repent. There yet remains a way back from this destructive path you've tread.
The woods yet cling to life, in all their stubborn glory.
Ngh...
...And that is the full story of this event.
Permit me to thank you for your aid in resolving the situation. What a deplorable state of affairs we find ourselves in.
I cannot believe that a fellow sylvan would resort to selling off the wood's blessings...
We must enact a rule which ensures that this manner of erring shall never repeat. And we will need to strictly manage our precious herbs—
Elder. Perhaps we could spread their cultivation techniques beyond the woods instead.
Isaac, what?!
Wh-what are you saying?! We are law- bound to protect these herbs and plants! Are you making light of that precept?!
Not in the slightest. Our laws are the culmination of our ancestral wisdom. They should be treated with care.
But here, your stubbornness in adhering to those laws has become a shackle, risking the livelihood of the very thing you wish to protect.
What are you saying?
Because our laws shrouded them in secrecy, the medicinal herbs were treated as highly valuable commodities, and as a result, this incident occurred.
But if we did away with that rule and spread our cultivation techniques wide, they would cease being a rare commodity, decreasing their black market value.
Hmph. You venture overmuch. Humans cannot raise the herbs, and the wider we spread word of them, the more the forest will suffer in turn.
Wrong. In the past, we laid down rules because cultivating the herbs was difficult. But modern farming techniques have advanced far more than you realize.
Rgh... But even so, the herbs are the blessing of the woods made manifest! They are a sylvan treasure!
We have cultivated these treasures over long years, and to give them to strangers who have made no such efforts...!
You would adhere to that belief even if it meant losing that treasure altogether? Even this most recent incident alone has razed several herb varieties from the earth.
Meanwhile, the camirela endures. Because it has been cultivated at the Halidom, its seeds can be sown once more.
Will you uphold our laws as they are and repeat the same mistakes? Or amend them for the sake of protecting the forest? What will you bequeath to the next generation?
I understand your reluctance to change. I was the same until just recently.
But you have nothing to fear. Even if the laws change, your heart—your desire to safeguard the woods you call home— never will.
...Hm. Amend our laws to protect the forest...
Sylas.
Sir?
Cooperate with the prince of the Halidom and teach the cultivation method for the camirela to all who would learn.
And then...I need you to deliver a letter to the Halidom. I must apologize to that human.
Of course. I will also have camirela seeds brought here.
You have my gratitude for your understanding.
All we do, we do to leave a healthy and vigorous forest for future generations. I did what I ought.
Young though you may be, you truly speak with the wood's best interests at heart. You have taught me a profound lesson. And with that, I am off.
You're one heck of a guy, Isaac. You convinced that stubborn old elder to see reason.
I was simply making use of what I learned at the Halidom.
Identifying what needs to change and what needs to be maintained is necessary for protecting our traditions and culture.
I would never have learned that had I remained in Initio forever. Thank you for broadening my horizons.
Hee hee! No thanks necessary, bub.
After all, no matter where we hail from, we're all sylvans!
Yeah. And we want to see our sylvan culture passed on, the same as you.
Sarisse... Luca... I am glad I met you both.
Come once more to the holy land to visit. Yggdrasil and I will welcome you both.
Yeah! We will for sure! It's a promise.
And until that time comes, I'll protect Initio with all I have to give—I swear it on my title as a guardsman of the verdure.
